key_title: Key to the species of Phyllangium

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Loganiaceae

source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Loganiaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1999). Loganiaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Styles connate; leaves elliptic, narrowly elliptic or narrowly obovate (0.8–4 mm wide); corolla 2.5–5.4 mm long; involucre 6-, 8- or 9-veined
Styles separate; leaves linear (filiform in aquatic forms) to very narrowly ovate (0.2–1.2 mm wide); corolla 1.4–1.7 mm long; involucre 6-veined
Involucre 8- or 9-veined; seeds brown or grey, finely reticulate
Involucre 6-veined, rarely with 4 additional veins; seeds black, sulcate
